comments:
I tried run my ant script like I do on WindowsXP, but I received no response.
All I see is a blank console with stop button enabled.

I've had the same problem, after some investigation. I've come to the conclusion
that the ANT_HOME environment variable and it's libs dependency are the culprit.
After upgrading to 3.1 M7, the eclipse ant version was upgraded from 1.6.2 to
1.6.3, but the old workspace still has the variable paths pointing to the now
non-existent org.apache.ant_1.6.2 folder. Just remove all those variables in the
ant rumtime tab of the preferences and reset them to the new path will fix this
problem.

In my point of view, this is still a bug, but it's a bug of workspace
compatibility. Similar problems that reside in personal workspaces have happened
before while upgrading eclipse. See bug 88350
My eclipse version is 3.1M6, thus ant folders are correct.

Leandro can you please give all the details of exactly how you are configuring 
your Ant build? Are you setting any build loggers? Can you also check to see if 
there are any related messages in the .log file?

I right-click ant file, go to Run As -> Ant Build, I did not change default
configuration of ant.
I see progress bar in 65% about three minutes and after the blank console.
While running eclipse, I see no log files on workspace/.metadata directory.
After shutdown eclipse, log file contains:

Is this any Ant buildfile or only a particular Ant buildfile?

I upgraded to 3.1M7 and my Ant does not work as well. I get a "Could not find 
the main class. Program will exit." dialog box. Nothing shows up in the log 
file.

I noticed the old classpath entries in my workspace (my old 3.0 workspace), so 
I corrected those. But still could not get Ant to work.

I then decided to create a new workspace and start from scratch, and setup my 
projects again. Still did not work.

I then created another workspace, a new test project, and created a new 
build.xml using the sample targets, and this still did not work.

To be sure, I removed from my system path another ant installation (1.6.2) I 
have on my system, but this had no effect.

I'm not sure what to do now. I read about deleting your .launch files in bug 
88350 but this did not help (I tried it my brand new workspace with the test 
project, which problably didn't have any previous launches).

Please see my config dump.

We have had reports that having entries on the java.library.path with spaces is 
causing problems. Richard's report would indicate this as a possible symptom.
I am investigating. See bug 95611.

I do not believe this is Leandro's problem. My suspsion there is we are having 
trouble communicating with the remote Ant VM. Do you have an aggressive 
firewall installed?
 If you set the build to run in the same JRE (see the JRE tab for your Ant 
launch configuration) does the build succeed?

Setting Ant to run in the same JRE as my workspace did the trick. I can now 
use Ant again from within Eclipse 3.1M7.

As an aside, I do have Norton Internet Security Professional installed (which 
has firewall components). I disabled it and ran Ant in a separate JRE (my 
previous setting), and it did not work. So I think I can rule out the firewall 
idea.

Thanks, for you help. Good luck with the fix.

Rich

(In reply to comment #8)
> We have had reports that having entries on the java.library.path with spaces 
is 
> causing problems. Richard's report would indicate this as a possible symptom.
> I am investigating. See bug 95611.
> I do not believe this is Leandro's problem. My suspsion there is we are 
having 
> trouble communicating with the remote Ant VM. Do you have an aggressive 
> firewall installed?
>  If you set the build to run in the same JRE (see the JRE tab for your Ant 
> launch configuration) does the build succeed?

I followed instructions in bug 95611 and turned off "Set an Input Handler" on 
the Main page of the Ant launch configuration. I then set Ant back to run in a 
separate JRE, and this setup works also.

I will use this workaround for now, though I don't know what functionality I 
lose by turning off "Set an Input Handler".

Thanks,
Rich
Any Ant <input> task execution will fail.

I disabled my firewall (iptables) and now Ant works perfectly.
I'm sorry for post this "bug".
Thank you
No problem Leandro. Glad things are working.
